thread.title: Saved by the Bell's Lark Voorhies calls off six-month marriage

title: Saved by the Bell's Lark Voorhies calls off six-month marriage
text:
Saved by the Bell's Lark Voorhies calls off six-month marriage - WMBFNews.com, Myrtle Beach/Florence SC, Weather Member Center: Saved by the Bell's Lark Voorhies calls off six-month marriage Updated: Saved by the Bell's Lark Voorhies calls off six-month marriage Just six months after marrying in Las Vegas, Saved by the Bell's Lark Voorhies and her husband Jimmy Green are getting a divorce, TMZ reports. More >> Just six months after marrying in Las Vegas, Saved by the Bell's Lark Voorhies and her husband Jimmy Green are getting a divorce, TMZ reports. More >> We're guessing Kim's not going to be too happy about this. More >> We're guessing Kim's not going to be too happy about this. More >> Chris Rock is hosting the Oscars Chris Rock will host the 2016 Oscars, ABC announced Wednesday. This will be Rock's second time hosting the awards show, which he previously emceed in 2005. More >> Chris Rock will host the 2016 Oscars, ABC announced Wednesday. This will be Rock's second time hosting the awards show, which he previously emceed in 2005. More >> Bill Cosby fires lawyer Martin Singer Bill Cosby has dropped his longtime lawyer, Martin Singer, amid the growing number of sexual assault accusations against him, according to TheWrap. More >> Bill Cosby has dropped his longtime lawyer, Martin Singer, amid the growing number of sexual assault accusations against him, according to TheWrap. More >> 
By Shelli Weinstein, 
Just six months after marrying in Las Vegas, Saved by the Bell 's Lark Voorhies and her husband Jimmy Green are getting a divorce, TMZ reports. 
The two wed in April after meeting on Facebook just a year earlier. 
Green reportedly told TMZ that the marriage has been an unhappy one from the beginning. Voorhies previously defended her soon-to-be-ex against her mother, Patricia, who filed a restraining order against Green in July. 
According to Patricia's court filing, Green was insistent on sleeping at her home where Voorhies was staying, and was verbally abusive. Patricia claimed that her daughter was living with her because she was "psychologically, mentally and emotionally fragile."
